movies.name: The Shawshank Redemption
movies.stars: Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton
movies.review: Two imprisoned men bond over a number of years, finding solace and eventual redemption through acts of common decency.

movies.name: The Godfather
movies.stars: Marlon Brando, Al Pacino, James Caan
movies.review: The Godfather follows Vito Corleone, Don of the Corleone family, as he passes the mantel to his unwilling son, Michael.

movies.name: The Godfather: Part II
movies.stars: Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Robert Duvall
movies.review: The early life and career of Vito Corleone in 1920s New York City is portrayed, while his son, Michael, expands and tightens his grip on the family crime syndicate.

movies.name: The Dark Knight
movies.stars: Christian Bale, Heath Ledger, Aaron Eckhart
movies.writers: Jonathan Nolan, Christopher Nolan, David S. Goyer
movies.review: When the menace known as the Joker wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham, Batman must accept one of the greatest psychological and physical tests of his ability to fight injustice.

movies.name: 12 Angry Men
movies.stars: Henry Fonda, Lee J. Cobb, Marin Balsam
movies.review: The jury in a New York City murder trial is frustrated by a single member whose skeptical caution forces them to more carefully consider the evidence before jumping to a hasty verdict.

movies.name: Schindler's List
movies.stars: Liam Neeson, Ralph Fiennes, Ben Kingsley
movies.review: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, industrialist Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

movies.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
movies.stars: Elijah Wood, Viggo Mortensen, Ian McKellen
movies.writers: J.R.R. Tolkien, Fran Walsh, Philippa Boyens
movies.review: Gandalf and Aragorn lead the World of Men against Sauron's army to draw his gaze from Frodo and Sam as they approach Mount Doom with the One Ring.
